thread.title: Carroll says Earl Thomas ready to go
thread.title_full: Carroll says Earl Thomas ready to go | The Seattle Times

author: Bob Condotta
title: Carroll says Earl Thomas ready to go
text:
The Seahawks won’t have strong safety Kam Chancellor for the opening game of the season Sunday at St. Louis.
But they will have free safety Earl Thomas.
Coach Pete Carroll made that clear during his Wednesday press conference, saying that Thomas “looks great.”
Thomas’ status has been a somewhat constant source of conjecture since he had surgery last February to repair a torn labrum in his shoulder, an injury suffered in the NFC Championship game win against Green Bay.
 Thomas was eased into training camp while still recovery and did not play in any preseason games.
But he has practiced fully for a couple of weeks with the team saying the goal has been to get him ready for the regular season.
Carroll said Wednesday he thinks that plan has worked.
“He’s worked hard,” Carroll said. “He’s had a fantastic off-season of conditioning. He’s run through camp the whole time. He’s been getting work by our trainer prior to when he came back to practice and he’s been running like crazy. He looks fast as ever. He looks great. So I don’t see any indication that he’s not ready.”
Thomas has not taken a hit on his shoulder and that will obviously bear some watching.
But Thomas appears ready to take that next step into the regular season.
Thomas has never missed a game since being drafted by the Seahawks in the first round in 2010, starting all 80 regular season games and eight in the playoffs.
Bob Condotta : 206-515-5699 or bcondotta@seattletimes.com ; on Twitter: @bobcondotta . Bob Condotta covers the Seahawks for the Seattle Times. He provides daily coverage of the team throughout the year.
